task.title: Viewing disconnected MQTT client-related statistics by using the
task.shortdesc: Use the disconnected MQTT clients monitor to view unconnected MQTT client statistics.

context.p: You can view unconnected MQTT client monitoring statistics by using the , or by using a . For more information about using a to view inactive MQTT client monitoring statistics, see . For more information about the predefined queries that you can run, see MQTT Client monitoring.

step.cmd: From the , select Monitoring Disconnected MQTT Clients.
Enter a value into Client ID. The default value is *.
Click Refresh to generate the output in the MQTT clients table.
You can limit the number of clients that are added to the table by selecting an value of 10, 25, 50, or 100. The default value is 10.
Enter a value into Filter, and click Apply Filter, and then click Refresh to change the visibility of the MQTT client data that is shown in the table.
To Delete a client (and any subscriptions that are associated with the client), complete the following steps:

ol.li: From the MQTT client table, select the client that you want to delete.
Click Actions, and select Delete Client to delete the client, and any subscriptions that are associated with the client.

result.p: The Timestamp is updated to show the time that query is generated.
The MQTT Clients table is updated to display the results of the query and any filter that is applied to those results.
